text:
e="preserve">Lloyd Cowan (8 July 1962 – January 2021) was a British track and field athlete. He was born in London.
Cowan was selected for the 1984 Los Angeles Olympics, but he could not go because of an illness. He represented England in the 110 metres hurdles event, at the 1994 Commonwealth Games.
He won his last medal at the AAA nationals in 1999.
On 11 January 2021, it was announced that Cowan had died at the age of 58.
